page.title: 01PORTSEA ISLAND
page.content: {The whole of our area has been shaped by man.Modern roads almost obliterate the tidal creek that,even today,makes Portsea an island by joining Portsmouth and Langstone Harbours. The landscape is by nature flat.A tree-covered ridge south of Port Creek is man-made:still called the Hilsea Lines it once was the defence works. two major roads mark our eastern and western boundaries,each flanked by water and open land.Our centre is a grid-pattern of suburban roads fringed on the east by industry and on the west by navy land. Earlier landscape shows where a road, instead of being straight, follows a curve follows the curve created over centuries by plough-teams turning at the edge of Stamshaw' s Common Field.
